intro: Tragacantha holosemia, commonly known as the Persian gum tree, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and woody, thorny stems. The plant produces a resinous gum, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Tragacantha holosemia is valued for its ecological role and economic significance in regions where it is found.
